thread.title: Responsible tourism: What's on the agenda at WTM
thread.title_full: Responsible tourism: What's on the agenda at WTM

title: Responsible tourism: What's on the agenda at WTM
text:
Save 
Animal conservation, child protection, gastronomy, cruising and winter sports tourism are just some of the other topics to be discussed over the four-day responsible tourism programme at WTM 2015. 
There are 15 sessions in total over the four days with the first day, Monday November 2, focusing on destination partnerships. 
Tuesday starts with animal conservation in national parks before moving to child protection, while local benefits of tourism and sustainability are covered in the afternoon. 
World Responsible Tourism Day (WRTD), the largest day of responsible tourism action in the world on Wednesday, will focus on carbon emissions. The final day of WTM looks at winter sports tourism, cruising and gastronomy. 
WTM senior director Simon Press said: “The World Responsible Tourism Programme is one of the most popular and best attended. It will be no different at WTM 2015 with a variety of topics to engage thought-provoking opinion and debate on critical subjects for the travel industry.” 
Speakers for the programme will be announced at a later date.
